intro: Bulbostylis trullata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bulbostylis, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are narrow and elongated, often forming dense clumps near the ground. Bulbostylis trullata is primarily of interest to botanists and ecologists due to its ecological role in wetland ecosystems.
